result.execSummary:
The defendant Brandon C Chapman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).
  • Carry Concealed Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.23(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence/count. Straight time.

miscConds.notes:
Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 
-  Provide a DNA sample.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- Random urine screens.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence/count. Huber release.

records.addlTxt: DOC request to clarify probation term on count two.  No action needed as count two involved the possession of a firearm.  DOC notified accordingly.
Copy of Notice of Intent, court record sheet and judgment of conviction forwarded to Attorney CHRIS DONOVAN 757 N BROADWAY #401, MILWAUKEE, WI 53202.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 3 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 1 day credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count.  Straight time.

As to Count 2:
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 MONTHS at the House of Corrections with 0 days credit CONSECUTIVE to any other sentence/count. Huber release.

Court STAYED the sentence in Counts 1 & 2 and placed the defendant on 2 YEARS probation.

  Conditions of Probation:
- 100 hours of community service.
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA); 
All applicable fees of supervision.
-  Cash bail on deposit to be applied if applicable. 

Filed:  
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
Pre-trial Incarceration Credit
Letters in Support of the Defendant
Ineligible Voting Notice received and filed.

At to Counts 1 & 2: Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 06/13/2016 is vacated.    Filed, original amended information; copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, waives formal reading, pleads not guilty.  
Court ordered Count 1 amended to Possession of THC, 2nd and Subsequent Offense, contrary to Wisconsin Statutes sections 961.41(3g)(e) and 939.50(3)(i), a Class I Felony.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 1, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for final pre-trial.  Court grants Defense motion for adjourned final pre-trial.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 7, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Certification of MOTION HEARING transcript commencing AUGUST 6, 2015 received and filed. (22 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to CHRIS DONOVAN, PRIVATELY RETAINED. kl

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for projected guilty plea, defense requests final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 5, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 13, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Danielle Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Plea hearing scheduled for February 23, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Christopher Donovan.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to review case.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Scheduling conference scheduled for January 26, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Notice of Appearance received and filed.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court.  Nick Cerwin for Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel.  Defense requests more time to retain counsel.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for December 17, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court.  Laura Ann Crivello for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for status of counsel, however defendant requests more time to retain counsel.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for November 16, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference at 10-12-2015 01:30 pm

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Scholz informs court that the defendant is unable to meet financial requirements.  Motion of the defense counsel to withdraw granted by the Court.  Defendant will be retaining new private counsel. Case is adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 22.  Status conference scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Motion to Withdraw received and filed.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Nicholas Steven Cerwin for Randy Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests more time, however case is set for plea hearing, if defendant does not wish to proceed he may request a jury trial at the next court date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
  Plea hearing scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for motion hearing.  Sworn for the state: West Allis Police Officer Richard Krueger.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court DENIED the defense motion to suppress fruits of vehicle search. 
Defense requests pre-trial conference date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
State's repsonse brief to defendant's motion to suppress evidence. Received and filed.
Defendant's motion to suppress fruits of vehicle search, received and filed.  aw
This assignment is only effective as on 8/3/2015.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Witkowiak, Br. 22.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has received additional discovery.  Defense counsel has filed a dispositive motion.  States response due 7/15/2015.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Defense counsel filed a substitution against Judge Konkol.  Case is now assigned to Judge Witkowiak, branch 22.  Clerk contacted Judge Watts court for the next court date.  Case adjourned for motion hearing on 8/6/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 22, in room 608 of the court house.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Motion hearing scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
State is going to copy additional discovery for the defense today.  Defense counsel wants file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/15/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is in trial.  Defense counsel is requesting additional discovery.  State to provide before next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/28/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  All motions due by next court date.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel requests time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 5/11/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Amy C Scholz.  Zachary Wittchow for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, and no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brandon C Chapman in court with attorney Timory Naples.  James C. Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. Defense enters a NOT GUILTY PLEA as to COUNT 2.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
SUMMONS MAILED. DEFENDANT ORDERED INTO ROOM 221 SAFETY BUILDING ON 4/2/15 @ 1:30 pm
